intro: Hippophae rhamnoides subsp. salicifolia, commonly known as the silver leaf sea buckthorn, is a shrub native to the coastal regions of western Europe and northern Africa. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine silvery or greyish pubescence. The plant produces small, yellow-orange berries that are rich in vitamins and antioxidants. It thrives in saline and coastal environments, often growing in dunes or on rocky shores. Its adaptability to harsh conditions makes it an important plant for coastal stabilization and ecological restoration.
